verses.roman:
tasmāt sarvātmanā tāta
nigṛhāṇa mano dhiyā
mayy āveśitayā yukta
etāvān yoga-saṅgrahaḥ

synonyms: tasmāt—therefore; sarva-ātmanā—in all respects; tāta—My dear Uddhava; nigṛhāṇa—bring under control; manaḥ—the mind; dhiyā—with intelligence; mayi—in Me; āveśitayā—which is absorbed; yuktaḥ—linked up; etāvān—thus; yoga-saṅgrahaḥ—the essence of spiritual practice.
translation: My dear Uddhava, fixing your intelligence on Me, you should thus completely control the mind. This is the essence of the science of yoga.
